snippet: The Russian-backed ground offensive followed a missile assault, reflecting what one official called a new phase of the Syria alliance.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow. Reporting was contributed by Alexandra Odynova from Moscow, Maher Samaan and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and Helene Cooper from Rome.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and ANDREW E. KRAMER

abstract: Russia and Syria carry out coordinated land, sea and air assault on rebel forces encroaching on Syrian coastal area critical to Pres Bashar al-Assad's power base; attack confirms Russia's committment to backing Assad and radically changes dynamic in Syrian fight, providing substantial boost to Assad and loyalists.
lead_paragraph: The Russian-backed ground offensive followed a missile assault, reflecting what one official called a new phase of the Syria alliance.

headline.print_headline: Russian Missiles Help Syrians Go on the Offensive
headline.main: Russian Cruise Missiles Help Syrians Go on the Offensive
